title: America Has Forgotten Its Liberalism
sub_head: The secret to U.S. success is what Adam Smith called ‘the obvious and simple system of natural liberty.’
body:
To make America great again, we must know what made her great the first time. Tunku Varadarajan, summarizing the views of John Cogan and Kevin Warsh (“America Needs a Return to First Principles,” Weekend Interview, April 30), emphasizes “ideas, individuals and institutions.” But the answer is simpler and more profound: liberalism. The secret to U.S. success is what Adam Smith called “the obvious and simple system of natural liberty.”
Liberalism here doesn’t mean the left side of our political spectrum. It is a political philosophy that respects human persons, detests institutional coercion and honors the rule of law. This means a politics of minimal government, an economics of free enterprise and a civil society of engaged and conscientious citizens.
